Thus have I heard. Once, the Buddha was at Jetavana AnÄthapiá¹‡á¸ada-ÄrÄma in the country of ÅšrÄvastÄ«.
He was together with a great assembly of bhiká¹£us and bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas.
At that time, King Prasenajit was in the great assembly.
He immediately rose from his seat, adjusted his robes,
bared his right shoulder, touched his right knee to the ground,
bowed at the Buddha's two feet, joined his palms in respect,
and addressed the Buddha, saying:
It is rare, World-Honored One.
The physiognomists predicted for me
that after seven days,
my life will surely come to an end.
I am afflicted by the suffering of impermanence,
and have come to rely on the World-Honored One without any other support.
I only pray that the World-Honored One will save and protect me.
How can I be freed from sorrow and suffering?
The Buddha said:
Great King, comfort yourself well and do not be afraid.
The Buddhas, the TathÄgatas, have skillful means.
Causing the great king to obtain extraordinary benefits and prolong his life.
You will attain supreme, perfect enlightenment.
Listen carefully, listen carefully, and contemplate it well.
I will explain it to you in detail.
Great King, you should know.
If you wish to escape impermanence, suffering, and distress, and transcend into the lifespan of the TathÄgata's Dharma body,
You should first generate the mind, uphold the Buddha's pure precepts, and cultivate the supreme merit.
You can generate this mind and prolong the king's life.
The king said to the Buddha:
I only wish that the World-Honored One will save and protect me.
The mind that is generated, the Buddha's pure precepts, and the cultivation of the supreme merit that are spoken of,
I will respectfully practice and also cause the people of the country to practice this Dharma.
I do not yet know what kind of mind is generated,
What kind of precepts are upheld, and what merit is supreme.
I only wish that the TathÄgata will proclaim it for me.
The Buddha told the great king:
Generating the mind means generating the four immeasurables.
As for upholding precepts, it means upholding the precept against killing.
Those who cultivate superior blessings have nothing better to do than to build stupas.
Compassionately saving and protecting all sentient beings.
The celestial good spirits always come to guard and protect.
They are inseparable like a shadow following a form.
It gives rise to the great king's boundless blessings and benefits.
Great King, the blessings and benefits of establishing a Buddha stupa are difficult to conceive of.
The Tathagatas of the three times all praise it together.
I will briefly explain the causes and conditions for the great king.
The king should listen attentively.
Long ago, there was a young boy who was herding cows on this land.
There were some physiognomists who came to read his physiognomy and said:
This cowherd will certainly exhaust his lifespan in seven days.
This cowherd, at another time,
was playing with other young boys by gathering sand.
Among them, a young boy pushed the sand into a pile.
Saying he was building a Buddha stupa one cubit high.
Some were two, some were three, up to four cubits.
At that time, this young boy playfully built a sand stupa one cubit high.
and extended his lifespan by another seven years.
When they were building sand stupas,
there was a pratyekabuddha who was walking while holding his alms bowl.ğŸ”½At that time, the young children,
with a playful mind,
offered sand to him, saying, We offer you flour.
At that time, the pratyekabuddha extended his bowl to receive it.
By his supernormal powers, the sand transformed into flour.
At that time, the young children, seeing this cause and effect,
all attained pure faith.
At that time, the pratyekabuddha gave a prophecy to the young children, saying,
You young ones, those who built stupas one cubit high,
in the future will become iron-wheel kings.
They will rule one world.
Those who built stupas two cubits high will become copper-wheel kings.
They will rule two worlds.
Those who built stupas three cubits high will become silver-wheel kings.
They will rule three worlds.
Those who built stupas four cubits high will become gold-wheel kings.
They will rule four worlds.
At that time, the young children, with a playful mind, built such a stupa and received such a result.
How much more so for the great king who gives rise to a sincere mind.
If there are good men and good women,
with a determined mind, who build a stupa according to the Dharma,
even if it is only one cubit, one handspan, one finger joint, or one grain of wheat in size,
the merit they will obtain will be immeasurable.
The devas will always rain down flowers to make offerings.
Therefore, great king,
if good men and good women wish to build a stupa,
they should first give rise to a mind of great compassion for all beings as their guide.
With the mind of enlightenment as their foundation,
they should then purify the ground, make an altar and make offerings.
Anoint it with cow's urine and burn incense, scatter flowers,
face east and sit, thinking like this:
The Buddha, the Blessed One, has perfected the merit of benefiting oneself and benefiting others.
He is also able to fulfill the wishes of sentient beings.
I now accomplish the foremost Dharma body and give rise to the mind of enlightenment.
The rules and procedures for building stupas for the Blessed One.
One should follow them in sequence according to the Dharma.
First, collect wonderful flowers.
Enchanted with the dharani seven times.
Scatter them on the altar to make offerings to the Tathagata.
The dharani says:

Namas' sattrat-o' buddh' atma-anojya-prapti-shesti-depi-buspa-ki-dam-ta-tha-gataya' tri-pyan-mu-ta-ya'ya' tatha'ga-ta-ya' arha-te sam-ya-k-sa-mu-ddha-ya' ta-dyatha' om buspa buspa buspa svaha' Second, when kneading the clay,
Visualize the letter A.
This is the Dharma body of the Tathagata.
First, one should take refuge and say this:

Oá¹ƒ bhÅ«á¸¥ prabhÅ«ta Äyuá¸¥ svÄhÄ. The Buddha told the great king:
If good men and good women,
with a pure mind, rely on this ritual method to create a Buddha stupa,
whether they do it themselves or instruct others to do it,
if they praise it or believe and accept it,
the merit they obtain is no different from creating a Buddha stupa.
One should know that in this life,
such a person will not be harmed by any poison.
Their lifespan will be long and they will not die an untimely death.
Ultimately, they will attain an indestructible body.
All ghosts and spirits will not dare to approach them.
The five stars and seven luminaries will follow and serve them.
All enemies will all retreat and scatter.
Wherever they are born, their bodies will always be free from illness.
All beings will be delighted to see them.
Those without pure precepts will have their pure precepts fulfilled.
Those who are not subdued will be able to subdue themselves.
Those who are impure will be able to purify themselves.
Those who have broken their precepts will have their precepts restored.
Those who have committed the four grave offenses and the five heinous crimes will all have their extremely grave offenses extinguished.
All the hindrances and burdens from beginningless eons will be exhausted.
If there is a woman who wishes to have a son,
she will give birth to a brave, healthy, and meritorious son.
The Four Heavenly Kings will always follow and protect him.
The merit of building a stupa is such that its blessings are like this.
If the stupa is destroyed and turned into fine dust,
the wind will blow a single dust mote and scatter it elsewhere.
Wherever the dust passes, through mountains, forests, rivers, and oceans,
all beings who come into contact with this dust
will never again receive a body of mixed types.
They will always be able to see the Buddha in their lives.
Great King, if good men and good women
In creating stupas and dharani
Clearly contemplate and single-mindedly recollect,
They will forever be free from the dangers of water, fire, kings, thieves,
And weapons that can harm them.
If in the wilderness or in a secluded place,
In a village or in a great assembly,
They are able to proclaim this sutra to the masses,
It will be a rescue and protection for the lives of sentient beings.
The merit and virtue they will obtain will be equal to space.
If in the future they copy and circulate it,
Even though the stupa has not yet been built, the merit of building the stupa will be no different.
I, for the sake of the Great King and all sentient beings in the future,
Have extensively revealed the merit and virtue of building stupas and prolonging life.
The King should remember it.
At that time, King Prasenajit and the great assembly,
Having heard the Buddha's teachings, all greatly rejoiced and faithfully accepted and practiced them.
